description.narrative: China Everbright International Limited (CEI or the Company) is incorporated in Hong Kong, China, and listed on the HKEX (0257.HK), focusing on energy conservation and environmental protection business, including waste-to-energy (WTE), wastewater treatment (WWT), Photovoltaic (PV), etc. The Company mostly operates under build-operate-transfer (BOT)/transfer-operate-transfer (TOT) model with concession period of around 25 years, and it also has build-transfer (BT) and build-own-operate (BOO) projects in operation. China Everbright Water Investments Limited (CEI Water or the water arm) is a wholly owned subsidiary of CEI, incorporated in the BVI, as the investment holding vehicles of all the water projects of CEI. The proposed IFC investment of a long-term senior debt to CEI Water will support the Company to develop 1 WWT, 1 surface water supply, and 1 waste water reuse project in China, with good development impacts.

i) Improve industrial water efficiency through recycling and reusing wastewater, in water shortage regions. ii) Reduce health risks and environmental pollution through improved wastewater collection and treatment. iii) Improve energy efficiency through wastewater heat pump technology to supply heating and cooling services to nearby communities that traditionally use electricity or coal. iv) Job creation by continuous building new water plants.
